com.apple.audio.hardware
Class AudioHardware

java.lang.Object
  com.apple.audio.hardware.AudioHardware
public final class AudioHardware
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides static methods to obtain information about the Audio Hardware that is currently available to the running system.

getProperty

public static int getProperty(int inPropertyID,
                              CAMemoryObject outProperty)
                       throws CAException
Gets the value of the requested property and places that value in the parameter outProperty. The user must provide a CAMemoryObject that should be at least large enough to hold the value of the queeried property, the size of which is obtained through calling getPropertyInfoSize.

This is a generic call in that the class that would truly represented the specified property is not known.

CoreAudio::AudioHardwareGetProperty

Parameters:
inPropertyID - the property for which the current value is sought
outProperty - will contain the value of the specified property upon return.
Returns:
the amount of bytes that were actually written into outProperty (starting at offset==0)
Throws:
CAException

unload

public static void unload()
                   throws CAException
When this routine is called, all IO on all devices within a process will be terminated and all resources capable of being released will be released. This routine essentially returns the HAL to it's uninitialized state.

CoreAudio::AudioHardwareUnload

Throws:
CAException
